subject: Writing
title: Korean Hangul: A Designed Alphabet
description: A 60-second lesson on Korean Hangul: A Designed Alphabet.

hook.text: Most writing systems evolved over centuries. Hangul was invented in a single royal decree.

buildup.text: In 1443, King Sejong of Korea commissioned a new alphabet so commoners could read and write.

discovery.text: Hangul's consonant shapes mirror the mouth positions used to produce each sound.

twist.text: Elites resisted it for centuries, calling it vulgar. They preferred Chinese characters for prestige.

climax.text: Today linguists call Hangul one of the most logical and scientific writing systems ever created.

punchline.text: A king designed literacy for his people, and it worked.

quiz.question: Who commissioned the creation of the Korean Hangul alphabet?
